elements.title: The Feast of Bacchus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Feast of Bacchus (pictured) went viral following a football game?

elements.title: George Schollenberger (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that George Schollenberger was so well known as a high-school football coach that teams in the National Football League sometimes asked for his opinions?

elements.title: Marcelle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that as the title character in Marcelle, actress Louise Gunning portrayed a Parisian barmaid who masquerades as her brother, a soldier?

elements.title: Rosa Laviña (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the anarchist Rosa Laviña opened the first vegetarian restaurant in Tolosa?

elements.title: Rewilding Argentina (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rewilding Argentina has reintroduced giant river otters, giant anteaters, and jaguars to the country?

elements.title: Neil Ritchie (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite being sacked after losing the Battle of Gazala, Neil Ritchie went on to command a corps in North West Europe?

elements.title: a Minneapolis TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Minneapolis TV station had newscasts that were "about as popular as the measles" with "sickening theme music"?

elements.title: Alfred Cowles (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Alfred Cowles stopped publishing his stock market newsletter as he could not predict the stock market?

elements.title: Ultimate Tumblr Sexyman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sans was crowned as "Ultimate Tumblr Sexyman" on the same day that Elizabeth II died?
